page.title: 14CHURCHES TIDMARSH/BASILDON
page.content: {St. Lawrence's Church,}Tidmarsh, dates from the 11th. century. It was re-opened in 1897 following extensive restoration. The oldest grave is dated 1777. There is a 150 year old tree in the graveyard. Until 1984 Tidmarsh (with Sulham) had it's own parish priest but it is now grouped with the parish of Pangbourne. { St. Stephen's Church}in Upper Basildon was built in 1964. The architect of St. Stephens was Peter Noel Perkins. The ground plan is designed in the shape of a fish, an unconventional and striking design. Perkins wished the church to be the visual focus of the village whilst retaining a family atmosphere. The church cost Â£12,600 to build. Inside hang two large pictures by Stephen Robertson-Roger a local artist.They depict the trial of St. Stephen.
